content.title: Disability Pension - West Bengal
content.department: Department of Women and Child Development and Social Welfare
content.beneficiary: Persons with disabilities who are unable to work
content.details: The West Bengal Disability Pension Scheme 2010 provides financial assistance to persons with disabilities who are unable to work and earn a living.
eligibility: Applicant must be a disable person with 40% of disability.

The disabled person must be declared unsuitable for physical work by the respective Medical officer with following disabilities: Deaf and Dumb, Blind, Orthopedically handicapped, Mentally retarded, Permanently incapacitated.
His / Her family income, if any, must not exceed ₹ 1,000/- per month.
The applicant must be a citizen of India and a resident of West Bengal or have been a resident of the state of West Bengal for at least 10 years at the time of applying for the pension.
exclusions: Individuals engaged in begging as a profession are not eligible for pension under this scheme.

Disabled persons already receiving 'Widow Pension,' 'Old Age Pension,' 'Farmers’ Pension,' or pension under the 'Family Pension Scheme' from the State Government, Central Government, or other concerns are not entitled to the pension under this scheme.

faqs.question: What is Disability Pension scheme?
faqs.answer: In 2010, the Women and Child Development and Social Welfare Department of the West Bengal State Government introduced the 'Disability Pension' scheme.

faqs.question: Who can get the benefits?
faqs.answer: All the eligible physically disable applicant of West Bengal state.

faqs.question: What is the financial eligibility criteria?
Can applicant from other states also get the benefit of this scheme?
What is the minimum number of years of residence required?
faqs.answer: Applicant must have been a resident of West Bengal for at least ten years on the date of making the application.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: 1. Get the application form. 2. Fill out the application form with required details. 3. Attach documents. 4. Submission of form.

faqs.question: How to get the application form?
faqs.answer: 1. Office of the Block Development Officer or the Executive Officer of the concerned Panchayat Samity in case of the applicant resides in the rural areas under the said Panchayat Samity. 2. Office of the Sub-Divisional Officer in case of the applicant resides in Municipal / Notified areas outside the areas of Kolkata Municipal Corporation, and 3. Office of the Controller of Vagrancy, West Bengal situated at Purta Bhawan, Bidhan Nagar, Kolkata-700091, in case of the applicant resides within the areas under Kolkata Municipal Corporation.

faqs.question: Can applicant download the application form online?
What documents are required?
faqs.answer: 1. Copy of Aadhaar self-attested. 2. Copy of Ration Card. 3. Copy of Voter Id. 4. Copy of Disability Certificate. 5. Copy of Income Certificate. 6. Copy of Husband’s Death Certificate. 7. Copy of Bank Pass Book. 8. Nomination Form (In case of death). 9. Passport Size photograph.
